conclusion: To find the potential difference \( U_{ab} \) using electromagnetic induction.
The length of the rod \( ab \) is given as \( 4L \).
The rod rotates with a constant angular velocity \( \omega \) around an axis passing through point \( O \).
The linear velocity \( v \) of the end \( b \) is \( v = \omega \times 4L \).
Use Faraday's Law of Induction for induced emf in a moving conductor.
The average velocity \( \bar{v} \) of the rod is \( 2\omega L \).
The induced emf \( \mathcal{E} \) is \( \mathcal{E} = B \times 2\omega L \times 4L \).
